messages.message:
Hey team, I am trying to update a sandbox but the flow keeps failing with the error:
```16:42:36  ------
16:42:36   > exporting to image:
16:42:36  ------
16:42:36  ERROR: failed to solve: failed to push 549230430157.dkr.ecr.us-east-2.amazonaws.com/instabase-dev/stats-adapter:jianwei.gong-frag-connector-24.10.08-e479ff97abf9fa9fe714e64fe6ab6ea772a669da (http://549230430157.dkr.ecr.us-east-2.amazonaws.com/instabase-dev/stats-adapter:jianwei.gong-frag-connector-24.10.08-e479ff97abf9fa9fe714e64fe6ab6ea772a669da): failed commit on ref "manifest-sha256:924721b377ccd64afbb3cb9cadccb8e6ebcd72e249498a33e182400dbc3602b5": unexpected status from PUT request to https://549230430157.dkr.ecr.us-east-2.amazonaws.com/v2/instabase-dev/stats-adapter/manifests/jianwei.gong-frag-connector-24.10.08-e479ff97abf9fa9fe714e64fe6ab6ea772a669da: 403 Forbidden
16:42:36  make: *** [Makefile:13: build-docker] Error 1```
Does anyone know what would be the fix here?
Drat. This is the tag limit issue again. Cleaned up alertmanager earlier today but it makes sense that the other static-but-excessively-pushed images would catch up soon. lol
@Jeff I cleaned up that repo, should be workable now

If you need to do so for any other images, you can run the script at `ecr-prune-tags-brute-force.sh`:

Dry-run (default):
`releng/scripts/ecr-prune-tags-brute-force.sh instabase-dev/stats-adapter`

Destructive:
`releng/scripts/ecr-prune-tags-brute-force.sh instabase-dev/stats-adapter --prune`
It looks like too much stuff got deleted? I have to run the install process after reviving the sandbox. https://frag-connector.internal.instabase.com/deployment-manager/installer
